noun.description: The side of a ship or aircraft that is on the right when one is facing forward.
examples: I made a steep turn to starboard

verb.description: Turn (a ship or its helm) to starboard.
examples: a red light is always a signal not to starboard the helm

origin: Old English stēorbord rudder side (see steer, board), because early Teutonic sailing vessels were steered with a paddle over the right side.
